poem:
Title: "A Snapshot on Sunset Boulevard"

Two Nikons dancing, slung on life's roughneck,
Caught in the faded light of Sunset Boulevard.
A boot repair shop, Amoeba music's marred
Threshold waits, dappled dusk on its old deck.
A man cries out, "I wanna die," his check,
His gun, reflecting more than meets the regard.
All carbs and chrome, it's bitter, it's hard –
A day's script, culled from the usual wreck.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. I went to a repair shop to have some boots resoled, then headed to Amoeba Music – although it didn’t open until". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
